content: 1 and row 2 on top of each other pretty sides together 2 line up the long edges 3 use the same whip stitch all the way across that long edge matching the corners and seams 4 tie off and weave in tails now you have one panel that is 3 blocks wide and 2 blocks tall repeat all of this for the second panel option b slip_stitch join with your hook this gives a thin neat join with a little ridge on one side step 1 put blocks together 1 take block 1 and block 2 from row 1 pg 24 www hodgepodge-crochet com 2 put them pretty sides facing each other 3 line up the edges step 2 slip_stitch across 1 make a slip knot on your hook 2 insert your hook through the first stitch on both blocks at the same time 3 yarn over and pull through both stitches and the loop on your hook o that s one slip_stitch 4 go to the next stitch on both blocks insert hook yarn over pull through both and through the loop 5 repeat across the whole edge 6 cut yarn pull through and weave in tails repeat for block 2 to block 3 in row 1 each join in row 2 then join row 1 to row 2 along the long edge make the second panel the same way you can choose which side of the ridge you like as the outside option c single_crochet join with a raised ridge this gives a chunky ridge between squares nice if you want the join to be a design feature step 1 put blocks together 1 take block 1 and block 2 from row 1 2 put them back sides together pretty sides facing out 3 line up the edges step 2 single_crochet across 1 make a slip knot on your hook 2 insert your hook through the first stitch of both blocks 3 yarn over pull through both stitches 2 loops on hook 4 yarn over pull through both loops 1 single_crochet made 5 move to the next stitch on both blocks and repeat 6 work 1 single_crochet in each pair of stitches across the edge 7 tie off and weave in tails repeat to join block 2 to block 3 in row 1 join the blocks in row 2 the same way then join row 1 to row 2 along the long edge make the second panel the same way your ridge will sit on the side facing you while you join if you want the ridge on the outside of the bag keep the outside facing you as you join add the top edging and handle one per panel pg 25 www hodgepodge-crochet com now you have two finished panels front and back of the bag you will work the top edging and handle on each panel separately you will work 4 row of single_crochet across the top work 1 handle row then 3 more row
